summary: REQ-39 asks to publish the currently deployed Version 30 by setting backend publication status to `PublicationStatus.#published` via the existing admin-only `publishApp` mechanism so users no longer see the takedown gate. The diff shows frontend work around querying publication status and adding/adjusting admin publication UI/hooks, but does not show any backend/state change that actually sets the deployed app’s publication status to published.

missing_requirements.requirement: Publish the currently deployed Version 30 build by setting the backend publication status to "published" (PublicationStatus.#published) using the existing admin-only publish mechanism (publishApp), so normal users are not blocked by the takedown/unpublished gate.
missing_requirements.reason: The diff only shows frontend changes (queries/UI) and does not include any backend/state/config change that would set the already-deployed app’s publication status to `#published`. Without an explicit state change in the deployed backend, the app may remain unpublished and continue showing the takedown gate.

hallucinated_features.description: Added/expanded admin UI to *unpublish* the app with an unpublish-reason form (in addition to publishing).
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-39 only requests publishing Version 30 to `published` using the existing publish mechanism; it does not request adding/changing unpublish controls or UX.

hallucinated_features.description: Introduced/expanded generalized authorization error classification messaging (including Educator/Parent role messaging).
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-39’s auth requirement is limited to non-admin publish attempts being rejected with an English authorization error and no non-admin publish UI exposure. Broad role-based authorization messaging changes are outside the publishing-only scope.
